page.title: 01The Area around Fletchertown
page.content: There are three villages in this area,Fletchertown,Mealsgate and Boltongate. Fletchertown is the biggest.There is a disused railway between Mealsgate and Fletchertown and the station at Mealsgate is now a large house.There is a sub-post office in each village.The main road between Carlisle and Cockermouth runs through Mealsgate and there is a garage,hotel and caravan site on this road,within our area. The River Ellen runs through a valley near Boltongate and there are many small becks and footpaths.There are several small mixed plantations and at least nine disused quarries.The Water Board have a Filter Works near Boltongate and there are four reservoirs,two of which are covered. There are several large houses,some of which are farmhouses and others built for the quarries,and waterworks.
